hotspots.hotspot:
Title

The title tells you that the graph has divided the contributions from PACS, or political action committees, among three different types of candidates for Congress.

Incumbents

Incumbents are those Representatives and Senators already in Congress.

Challengers

Challengers are those people running for office who want to unseat incumbents.

Open seats

Open seats are those districts with no current representative.

PAC Recipients

The size of the incumbents slice is obviously larger than any other slice. Without even looking at a total dollar amount, you can easily see that incumbents received the most money from PACs.

PAC Total

The total amount that PACs contributed to congressional candidates in 2008 was $386 million dollars. We calculate this answer by adding up the dollar figures on all three slices of the pie—$305 million, $49 million, and $32 million.
